channel.title: Suggestions
channel.description:
Dunno if these have been asked before, but I'll give it a shot.
First.. I think we should expand the programming section, maybe into sub-sections as Visual basics, c++, etc. It gets someone annoying when I'm trying to learn something, and it goes from language to language, and so on. It might work out for people wishing to learn a specific thing.
Second.. Theres a board here called "RS Private Servers" One topic that re-directs to moparisthebest.com I think it should be at the top of the forum(for the people who don't want it, hide it) That way they will be re-directed, and(hopefully) will stay off these forums, or completely removed.
Well, my ideas.

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

and while your board cleaing, dump the srl section we aren’t the home of srl anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:145962”][quote author=Frell link=topic=199865.msg1777344#msg1777344 date=1190613111]
How about the board is hidden when your a “member”? So after you have posted a decent a amount, you know where your going and staying. Like the post count member.
[/quote]
That is also a good idea and easy to do. Consider it done.[/quote]
Glad i could help :).

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

First:
If you look in the general programming section, you will still see topics that haven’t been posted in since September 11th, and they look to be all uniformly distributed between Delphi, C++, and VB. That means the section isn’t very active as is with at least 3 languages in it, so it is not nearly active enough to be split off into different sections right?

Second:
I never really thought about it and just left the board where it was before the move, but it could work and so I will try it, thanks.

Frell:

How about the board is hidden when your a “member”? So after you have posted a decent a amount, you know where your going and staying. Like the post count member.

That is also a good idea and easy to do. Consider it done.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

i guess cahnge is good, but i would be uncomfertable with the boards moving aroound after over a year and a half

and ditto to sdouble on the prgramming one, not enough threads. if tere are, mopar has asid before that he will change it i think, but there isn’t enuough interest.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

For the second:

When I was admin on kait’s, i recommended a forum layout change for this reason (only it was aryan at the time) and kait said have at it. He wanted me to leave the general at the topc because he wanted it to be the catchall of the stupid posts so I did. It worked quite well, I had to move much less threads than before.

For the first:

By sorting these out, there would be about 10 threads in some sections. So how it is now should be perfectly fine, as long as whoever started the thread says what language it is in the subject.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @_CopyRight CopyRight
item.description:
@_CopyRight wrote:

I like the second, very nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Dunno if these have been asked before, but I’ll give it a shot.

First…
I think we should expand the programming section, maybe into sub-sections as Visual basics, c++, etc.
It gets someone annoying when I’m trying to learn something, and it goes from language to language, and so on.
It might work out for people wishing to learn a specific thing.

Second…
Theres a board here called “RS Private Servers”
One topic that re-directs to moparisthebest.com
I think it should be at the top of the forum(for the people who don’t want it, hide it)
That way they will be re-directed, and(hopefully) will stay off these forums, or completely removed.

Well, my ideas.
